spans.text: KEY TAKEAWAYS:

lines.text: •	 Sharing sensitive personal and non-personal data without adequate safeguards can exacerbate

spans.text: •	 Sharing sensitive personal and non-personal data without adequate safeguards can exacerbate

lines.text: risks for crisis-affected people, humanitarian organizations and donors.

lines.text: INTRODUCTION

spans.text: INTRODUCTION

lines.text: Donors have an important role in the humanitarian data ecosystem, both as drivers of increased data

spans.text: Donors have an important role in the humanitarian data ecosystem, both as drivers of increased data

lines.text: collection and analysis, and as direct users of data. This is not a new phenomenon; the need for

spans.text: collection and analysis, and as direct users of data. This is not a new phenomenon; the need for

lines.text: accountability and transparency in the use of donor funding is broadly understood and respected. However,

spans.text: accountability and transparency in the use of donor funding is broadly understood and respected. However,

lines.text: in recent years, donors have begun requesting data that can be sensitive. This includes personal data about

spans.text: in recent years, donors have begun requesting data that can be sensitive. This includes personal data about

lines.text: beneficiaries and various forms of disaggregated data, such as household-level survey results and data

spans.text: beneficiaries and various forms of disaggregated data, such as household-level survey results and data

lines.text: about the delivery of assistance disaggregated by demographic and/or group dimensions (e.g. ethnicity,

spans.text: about the delivery of assistance disaggregated by demographic and/or group dimensions (e.g. ethnicity,

lines.text: protection group, etc.).

spans.text: protection group, etc.).

lines.text: Concerns around requests for such data have led donors and humanitarian organizations to place more

spans.text: Concerns around requests for such data have led donors and humanitarian organizations to place more

lines.text: emphasis on identifying strategies for data responsibility: the safe, ethical and effective management

spans.text: emphasis on identifying strategies for data responsibility: the safe, ethical and effective management

lines.text: of data. Data responsibility requires donors and humanitarian organizations to take actions that help

spans.text: of data. Data responsibility requires donors and humanitarian organizations to take actions that help

lines.text: minimize risks while maximizing benefits of data. This is particularly challenging in cases where donors

spans.text: minimize risks while maximizing benefits of data. This is particularly challenging in cases where donors

lines.text: request sensitive data. For example, the screening of aid recipients, which is often used to justify requests

spans.text: request sensitive data. For example, the screening of aid recipients, which is often used to justify requests

lines.text: for personal data, is not only difficult to practically implement, but also highly problematic in terms of

spans.text: for personal data, is not only difficult to practically implement, but also highly problematic in terms of

lines.text: principled aid.

spans.text: principled aid.

spans.text: Because there are well-established and accepted standards and mechanisms for sharing financial information with donors, including a role for external

lines.text: audits, requests for financial data are not included in this guidance note. This guidance note deals with sensitive personal and non-personal data.

lines.text: DONOR REQUESTS FOR DATA

spans.text: DONOR REQUESTS FOR DATA

lines.text: Donors regularly request data from their partners in order to fulfil different obligations and objectives.

spans.text: Donors regularly request data from their partners in order to fulfil different obligations and objectives.

lines.text: These requests can be either formal or informal.

spans.text: These requests can be either formal or informal.

lines.text: •	 Formal requests

spans.text: •	 Formal requests

lines.text: tend to be included in grant agreements in relation to reporting criteria, and are

spans.text: tend to be included in grant agreements in relation to reporting criteria, and are

lines.text: typically based on legal requirements such as compliance with counter-terrorism laws. Such requests

spans.text: typically based on legal requirements such as compliance with counter-terrorism laws. Such requests

lines.text: tend to be negotiated at the outset of a partnership or grant agreement, and are usually made in

spans.text: tend to be negotiated at the outset of a partnership or grant agreement, and are usually made in

lines.text: writing and scheduled in advance.

spans.text: writing and scheduled in advance.

lines.text: •	 Informal requests

spans.text: •	 Informal requests

lines.text: concern information or data that typically fall outside of the normal scope  of

spans.text: concern information or data that typically fall outside of the normal scope  of

lines.text: reporting. These ad-hoc requests often carry implicit value, meaning that while they are not

spans.text: reporting. These ad-hoc requests often carry implicit value, meaning that while they are not

lines.text: formally required, delivering this supplementary data is deemed beneficial for an organization’s

spans.text: formally required, delivering this supplementary data is deemed beneficial for an organization’s

lines.text: ongoing engagement and partnership with a donor. These requests represent a greater dilemma for

spans.text: ongoing engagement and partnership with a donor. These requests represent a greater dilemma for

lines.text: humanitarian actors.

spans.text: humanitarian actors.

spans.text: Few donors have formal data sharing policies or guidelines in place.
There is also a lack of shared

lines.text: understanding of terminology and of the objectives and risks around data sharing. There are different

spans.text: understanding of terminology and of the objectives and risks around data sharing. There are different

lines.text: definitions and understanding of data-related risks, leading to inconsistent and sometimes contradictory

spans.text: definitions and understanding of data-related risks, leading to inconsistent and sometimes contradictory

lines.text: practices around sharing potentially sensitive data with donors in a particular context.

spans.text: practices around sharing potentially sensitive data with donors in a particular context.

lines.text: OBJECTIVES FOR DATA SHARING WITH DONORS

spans.text: OBJECTIVES FOR DATA SHARING WITH DONORS

lines.text: The most commonly identified objectives for donors requesting sensitive data from partners are

spans.text: The most commonly identified objectives for donors requesting sensitive data from partners are

lines.text: situational awareness and programme design; accountability and transparency; and legal, regulatory, and

spans.text: situational awareness and programme design; accountability and transparency; and legal, regulatory, and

lines.text: policy requirements.

spans.text: policy requirements.

lines.text: Situational awareness and programme design

spans.text: Situational awareness and programme design

lines.text: Donors seek information and data from humanitarian organizations in order to understand and react

spans.text: Donors seek information and data from humanitarian organizations in order to understand and react

lines.text: to changes in humanitarian contexts. This allows donors to improve their own programme design and

spans.text: to changes in humanitarian contexts. This allows donors to improve their own programme design and

lines.text: evaluation, prevent duplication of assistance, identify information gaps, and ensure appropriate targeting

spans.text: evaluation, prevent duplication of assistance, identify information gaps, and ensure appropriate targeting

lines.text: of assistance.

spans.text: of assistance.

lines.text: Accountability and transparency

spans.text: Accountability and transparency

lines.text: Donors and humanitarian organizations have an obligation to account for their activities. Data can enable

spans.text: Donors and humanitarian organizations have an obligation to account for their activities. Data can enable

lines.text: donors to explain and defend funding on foreign aid to taxpayers.

spans.text: donors to explain and defend funding on foreign aid to taxpayers.

lines.text: Legal, regulatory, and policy requirements

spans.text: Legal, regulatory, and policy requirements

lines.text: Donors are subject to certain national and international legal requirements, including political, legal and

spans.text: Donors are subject to certain national and international legal requirements, including political, legal and

lines.text: statutory requirements related to counter-terrorism, migration and law enforcement. In many cases,

spans.text: statutory requirements related to counter-terrorism, migration and law enforcement. In many cases,

lines.text: donors might want to use data to verify their compliance with these different requirements. Some donors

spans.text: donors might want to use data to verify their compliance with these different requirements. Some donors

lines.text: include counterterrorism clauses in their grant agreements, which are intended to ensure that their funds

spans.text: include counterterrorism clauses in their grant agreements, which are intended to ensure that their funds

lines.text: are not used to benefit designated terrorist groups.  Similarly, donors might include clauses to cover anti-

spans.text: are not used to benefit designated terrorist groups.
Similarly, donors might include clauses to cover anti-

lines.text: bribery, anti-fraud and anti-corruption measures.

spans.text: bribery, anti-fraud and anti-corruption measures.

spans.text: understanding regarding the sensitivity of non-personal data. These data policy gaps increase the risk of

lines.text: Purpose limitation

spans.text: Purpose limitation

lines.text: The principle of purpose limitation requires that data is only collected for specified, explicit and legitimate

spans.text: The principle of purpose limitation requires that data is only collected for specified, explicit and legitimate

lines.text: purposes, and that it not be processed further in a manner that would be incompatible with those

spans.text: purposes, and that it not be processed further in a manner that would be incompatible with those

lines.text: purposes.  Even when donors specify legitimate reasons for requesting data in-line with the original

spans.text: purposes.
Even when donors specify legitimate reasons for requesting data in-line with the original

lines.text: purposes for which the data was collected (e.g. the delivery of humanitarian assistance), it can be difficult

spans.text: purposes for which the data was collected (e.g. the delivery of humanitarian assistance), it can be difficult

lines.text: to ensure that the data will not be used for other purposes once shared. Data used out of context and for

spans.text: to ensure that the data will not be used for other purposes once shared. Data used out of context and for

lines.text: purposes that are not known at the time of sharing, or retained past the intended retention for a defined

spans.text: purposes that are not known at the time of sharing, or retained past the intended retention for a defined

lines.text: purpose represents a violation, even if unintended, of the data subjects’ rights.
